intro: Mascagnia tucuruensis, commonly known as the Tucuruí nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades and tomatoes. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, thick leaves, and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple. It produces small, round berries that contain the toxic alkaloid solasodine. Due to its toxic properties, it is often avoided by both animals and humans.
